column5: I was wondering if anyone has some words about the positives and negatives (if any) using Fireline Crystal. I am thinking of using it on my salmon rod with a large shimano spinning reel. I fish from the bank or piers, any help would be greatly appreciated.
I took it off all my reels and only use it as backing on my baitcaster as filler.  It's not round and doesn't cast well.  I have never had a problem with spiderwire on any reel.
I've used it and i do like it. Only one of my reels have Fireline Crystal and the rest power pro. So far i'm happy with it.
Never used it, but it has a thick dia. that would cut down on capacity.
Ive bought it, and dont like it..  I use the regular fireline and swaer by it!
It SUCKS never made it threw the day & it was in the garbage Richard
I like it and think you will be very happy with it on a pier fishing set-up. I use it on my spinning rods only and use power pro on my baitcasters. I even use the 10lb test crystal on my ultra-light.
Thanks for the thoughts guys,  I asked a couple of my friends on my instant messanger as well and they don't recommend it either. I think I will stick with Power Pro.
Stick with Power Pro. The Fireline Crystal frays very easily, and does not cast as well as the same diameter Power Pro.
I don't like it is too slippery and hard to tie knots with.  P-line ,Stren Super braid or Power pro are much better choices.
i still like mono, or if i'm feeling saucy, mono with a fluoro leader. i haven't liked a braid or superline more than plain mono yet.
After I use PowerPro I decided to drop FireLine. PowerPro is better.

yup im with Dr.S, i just used 10lb berkley trilene mono. and i caught a 22" roughly 6lb salmon tonight with it! and if your paying attention it doesnt fray.... at least with me anyway. i just did buy some berkley stuff.... the package is silver, im pretty sure its flouro....
All fireline frays easy, other then that its good. For this reason I switched to strictly power pro. Power pro just loses its die a bit.
I use it and like it, pretty strong stuff. But out on Georgian Bay with all the rocks, it frays alot. If power pro had a white version, I'd use that.

Some reels have poorly engineered bails that have sharp corners that fray the line as well. Anyone with a quantum energy pt-i take a look at the corner of the bail. 170$ reel and it frays line  . From now on when selecting a reel I pay close attention to this small detail.
I have the same issue, angry to say the least.  Let me know when you come up with a solution, I have struck out so far.
I never tried the crystal, but have been using regular Fireline for years on my spinning rods and love it. I also use power pro and have not had issues with that either.
